Hebrew: וְאָמַ֣ר אֵלָ֔יו מָ֧ה הַמַּכּ֛וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה בֵּ֣ין יָדֶ֑יךָ וְאָמַ֕ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֻכֵּ֖יתִי בֵּ֥ית מְאַהֲבָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: And if he is asked, “What are those sores on your back?” he will reply, “From being beaten in the homes of my friends.”
Transliteration: veamar elayv mah hamakhvot haeleh veyn yadeykha veamar asher hukheytiy veyt meahavay {f}

Hebrew: חֶ֗רֶב עוּרִ֤י עַל־רֹעִי֙ וְעַל־גֶּ֣בֶר עֲמִיתִ֔י נְאֻ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת הַ֤ךְ אֶת־הָרֹעֶה֙ וּתְפוּצֶ֣יןָ הַצֹּ֔אן וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֥י יָדִ֖י עַל־הַצֹּעֲרִֽים׃
Translated:
O sword!
Rouse yourself against My shepherd,
The man in charge of My flock
—says GOD of Hosts.
Strike down the shepherd
And let the flock scatter;
And I will also turn My hand
Against all the shepherd boys.
Transliteration: cherev uriy al-roiy veal-gever amiytiy neum yehovah tsevavot hakhe et-haroeh utefutseyna hatson vahashivotiy yadiy al-hatsoariym

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה בְכׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה פִּֽי־שְׁנַ֣יִם בָּ֔הּ יִכָּרְת֖וּ יִגְוָ֑עוּ וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁ֖ית יִוָּ֥תֶר בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Throughout the land
—declares GOD—
Two-thirds shall perish, shall die,
And one-third of it shall survive.
Transliteration: vehayah vekhׇl-haarets neum-yehovah fiy-shenayiim vah yikharetu yigevau vehashelishiyt yivater vah

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִ֤י אֶת־הַשְּׁלִשִׁית֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ וּצְרַפְתִּים֙ כִּצְרֹ֣ף אֶת־הַכֶּ֔סֶף וּבְחַנְתִּ֖ים כִּבְחֹ֣ן אֶת־הַזָּהָ֑ב ה֣וּא ׀ יִקְרָ֣א בִשְׁמִ֗י וַֽאֲנִי֙ אֶעֱנֶ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ עַמִּ֣י ה֔וּא וְה֥וּא יֹאמַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽי׃ {פ}
Translated:
That third I will put into the fire,
And I will smelt them as one smelts silver
And test them as one tests gold.
They will invoke Me by name,
And I will respond to them.
I will declare, “You are My people,”
And they will declare,
“ The ETERNAL is our God!”
Transliteration: vehevetiy et-hashelishiyt vaesh utserafetiym khitserof et-hakhesef uvechanetiym khivechon et-hazahav hu yikera vishemiy vaaniy eeneh otvo amaretiy amiy hu vehu yomar yehovah elohay {f}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה יֽוֹם־בָּ֖א לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְחֻלַּ֥ק שְׁלָלֵ֖ךְ בְּקִרְבֵּֽךְ׃
Translated: Lo, a day of G<small>OD</small> is coming when your spoil shall be divided in your very midst!
Transliteration: hineh yvom-va layhovah vechulak shelalekhe vekirevekhe

Hebrew: וְאָסַפְתִּ֨י אֶת־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם ׀ אֶֽל־יְרוּשָׁלַ֘͏ִם֮ לַמִּלְחָמָה֒ וְנִלְכְּדָ֣ה הָעִ֗יר וְנָשַׁ֙סּוּ֙ הַבָּ֣תִּ֔ים וְהַנָּשִׁ֖ים (תשגלנה) [תִּשָּׁכַ֑בְנָה] וְיָצָ֞א חֲצִ֤י הָעִיר֙ בַּגּוֹלָ֔ה וְיֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם לֹ֥א יִכָּרֵ֖ת מִן־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: For I will gather all the nations to Jerusalem for war: The city shall be captured, the houses plundered, and the women violated; and a part of the city shall go into exile. But the rest of the population shall not be uprooted from the city.
Transliteration: veasafetiy et-khׇl-hagvoyim el-yerushala͏im lamilechamah venilekhedah haiyr venashasu havatiym vehanashiym (tshglnh) [tishakhavenah] veyatsa chatsiy haiyr vagvolah veyeter haam lo yikharet min-haiyr

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֣א יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנִלְחַ֖ם בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם הָהֵ֑ם כְּי֥וֹם הִֽלָּחֲמ֖וֹ בְּי֥וֹם קְרָֽב׃
Translated: Then G<small>OD</small> will come forth and make war on those nations as a fighter makes war on a day of battle.
Transliteration: veyatsa yehovah venilecham vagvoyim hahem kheyvom hilachamvo veyvom kerav

Hebrew: וְעָמְד֣וּ רַגְלָ֣יו בַּיּוֹם־הַ֠ה֠וּא עַל־הַ֨ר הַזֵּיתִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י יְרֽוּשָׁלַ֘͏ִם֮ מִקֶּ֒דֶם֒ וְנִבְקַע֩ הַ֨ר הַזֵּיתִ֤ים מֵֽחֶצְיוֹ֙ מִזְרָ֣חָה וָיָ֔מָּה גֵּ֖יא גְּדוֹלָ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וּמָ֨שׁ חֲצִ֥י הָהָ֛ר צָפ֖וֹנָה וְחֶצְיוֹ־נֶֽגְבָּה׃
Translated: On that day, God’s feet will stand on the Mount of Olives, near Jerusalem on the east; and the Mount of Olives shall split across from east to west, and one part of the Mount shall shift to the north and the other to the south, a huge gorge.
Transliteration: veamedu ragelayv vayyvom-hahu al-har hazeytiym asher al-feney yerushala͏im mikedem veniveka har hazeytiym mechetseyvo mizerachah vayamah gey gedvolah meod umash chatsiy hahar tsafvonah vechetseyvo-negevah

Hebrew: וְנַסְתֶּ֣ם גֵּיא־הָרַ֗י כִּי־יַגִּ֣יעַ גֵּֽי־הָרִים֮ אֶל־אָצַל֒ וְנַסְתֶּ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר נַסְתֶּם֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָרַ֔עַשׁ בִּימֵ֖י עֻזִּיָּ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה וּבָא֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֔י כׇּל־קְדֹשִׁ֖ים עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And the Valley in the Hills shall be stopped up, for the Valley of the Hills shall reach only to Azal; it shall be stopped up as it was stopped up as a result of the earthquake in the days of King Uzziah of Judah.—And the E<small>TERNAL</small> my God, with all the holy beings, will come to you.
Transliteration: venasetem gey-haray khiy-yagiya gey-hariym el-atsal venasetem khaasher nasetem mifeney haraash viymey uziyah melekhe-yehudah uva yehovah elohay khׇl-kedoshiym imakhe

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא לֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֣ה א֔וֹר יְקָר֖וֹת (יקפאון) [וְקִפָּאֽוֹן]׃
Translated: In that day, there shall be neither sunlight nor cold moonlight,
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu lo-yiheyeh vor yekarvot (ykfvn) [vekifavon]

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה יוֹם־אֶחָ֗ד ה֛וּא יִוָּדַ֥ע לַיהֹוָ֖ה לֹא־י֣וֹם וְלֹא־לָ֑יְלָה וְהָיָ֥ה לְעֵֽת־עֶ֖רֶב יִֽהְיֶה־אֽוֹר׃
Translated: but there shall be a continuous day—only G<small>OD</small> knows when—of neither day nor night, and there shall be light at eventide.
Transliteration: vehayah yvom-echad hu yivada layhovah lo-yvom velo-layelah vehayah leet-erev yiheyeh-vor

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יֵצְא֤וּ מַֽיִם־חַיִּים֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם חֶצְיָ֗ם אֶל־הַיָּם֙ הַקַּדְמוֹנִ֔י וְחֶצְיָ֖ם אֶל־הַיָּ֣ם הָאַחֲר֑וֹן בַּקַּ֥יִץ וּבָחֹ֖רֶף יִֽהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: In that day, fresh water shall flow from Jerusalem, part of it to the Eastern Sea and part to the Western Sea, throughout the summer and winter.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu eitseu mayiim-chayiym miyrushala͏im chetseyam el-hayam hakademvoniy vechetseyam el-hayam haacharvon vakayiits uvachoref yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִהְיֶ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶחָ֖ד וּשְׁמ֥וֹ אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> shall be sovereign over all the earth; in that day there shall be one G<small>OD</small> with one name.
Transliteration: vehayah yehovah lemelekhe al-khׇl-haarets vayyvom hahu yiheyeh yehovah echad ushemvo echad

Hebrew: יִסּ֨וֹב כׇּל־הָאָ֤רֶץ כָּֽעֲרָבָה֙ מִגֶּ֣בַע לְרִמּ֔וֹן נֶ֖גֶב יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְֽרָאֲמָה֩ וְיָשְׁבָ֨ה תַחְתֶּ֜יהָ לְמִשַּׁ֣עַר בִּנְיָמִ֗ן עַד־מְק֞וֹם שַׁ֤עַר הָֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ עַד־שַׁ֣עַר הַפִּנִּ֔ים וּמִגְדַּ֣ל חֲנַנְאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד יִקְבֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then the whole country shall become like the Arabah, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem. The latter, however, shall perch high up where it is, and shall be inhabited from the Gate of Benjamin to the site of the Old Gate, down to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananel to the king’s winepresses.
Transliteration: yisvov khׇl-haarets khaaravah migeva lerimvon negev yerushala͏im veraamah veyashevah tacheteyha lemishaar vineyamin ad-mekvom shaar harishvon ad-shaar hafiniym umigedal chananeel ad yikevey hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְיָ֣שְׁבוּ בָ֔הּ וְחֵ֖רֶם לֹ֣א יִֽהְיֶה־ע֑וֹד וְיָשְׁבָ֥ה יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לָבֶֽטַח׃ {ס}
Translated: Never again shall destruction be decreed, and Jerusalem shall dwell secure.
Transliteration: veyashevu vah vecherem lo yiheyeh-vod veyashevah yerushala͏im lavetach {s}

Hebrew: וְזֹ֣את ׀ תִּהְיֶ֣ה הַמַּגֵּפָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִגֹּ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר צָבְא֖וּ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם הָמֵ֣ק ׀ בְּשָׂר֗וֹ וְהוּא֙ עֹמֵ֣ד עַל־רַגְלָ֔יו וְעֵינָיו֙ תִּמַּ֣קְנָה בְחֹֽרֵיהֶ֔ן וּלְשׁוֹנ֖וֹ תִּמַּ֥ק בְּפִיהֶֽם׃
Translated: As for those peoples that warred against Jerusalem, G<small>OD</small> will smite them with this plague: Their flesh shall rot away while they stand on their feet; their eyes shall rot away in their sockets; and their tongues shall rot away in their mouths.
Transliteration: vezot tiheyeh hamagefah asher yigof yehovah et-khׇl-haamiym asher tsaveu al-yerushala͏im hamek vesharvo vehu omed al-ragelayv veeynayv timakenah vechoreyhen uleshvonvo timak vefiyhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא תִּהְיֶ֧ה מְהֽוּמַת־יְהֹוָ֛ה רַבָּ֖ה בָּהֶ֑ם וְהֶחֱזִ֗יקוּ אִ֚ישׁ יַ֣ד רֵעֵ֔הוּ וְעָלְתָ֥ה יָד֖וֹ עַל־יַ֥ד רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: In that day, a great panic from G<small>OD</small> shall fall upon them, and everyone shall snatch at the hand of another, and everyone shall raise their hand against everyone else’s hand.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu tiheyeh mehumat-yehovah ravah vahem vehecheziyku iysh yad reehu vealetah yadvo al-yad reehu

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם־יְהוּדָ֔ה תִּלָּחֵ֖ם בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְאֻסַּף֩ חֵ֨יל כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֜ם סָבִ֗יב זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֛סֶף וּבְגָדִ֖ים לָרֹ֥ב מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Judah shall join the fighting in Jerusalem, and the wealth of all the nations round about—vast quantities of gold, silver, and clothing—shall be gathered in.
Transliteration: vegam-yehudah tilachem viyrushala͏im veusaf cheyl khׇl-hagvoyim saviyv zahav vakhesef uvegadiym larov meod

Hebrew: וְכֵ֨ן תִּהְיֶ֜ה מַגֵּפַ֣ת הַסּ֗וּס הַפֶּ֙רֶד֙ הַגָּמָ֣ל וְהַחֲמ֔וֹר וְכׇ֨ל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִֽהְיֶ֖ה בַּמַּחֲנ֣וֹת הָהֵ֑מָּה כַּמַּגֵּפָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: The same plague shall strike the horses, the mules, the camels, and the donkeys; the plague shall affect all the animals in those camps.
Transliteration: vekhen tiheyeh magefat hasus hafered hagamal vehachamvor vekhׇl-havehemah asher yiheyeh vamachanvot hahemah khamagefah hazot

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כׇּל־הַנּוֹתָר֙ מִכׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם הַבָּאִ֖ים עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְעָל֞וּ מִדֵּ֧י שָׁנָ֣ה בְשָׁנָ֗ה לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺת֙ לְמֶ֙לֶךְ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת וְלָחֹ֖ג אֶת־חַ֥ג הַסֻּכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: All who survive of all those nations that came up against Jerusalem shall make a pilgrimage year by year to bow low to the Supreme G<small>OD</small> of Hosts and to observe the Feast of Booths.
Transliteration: vehayah khׇl-hanvotar mikhׇl-hagvoyim havaiym al-yerushala͏im vealu midey shanah veshanah lehishetachavot lemelekhe yehovah tsevavot velachog et-chag hasukhvot

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיָ֠ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יַעֲלֶ֜ה מֵאֵ֨ת מִשְׁפְּח֤וֹת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶל־יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֔ת לְמֶ֖לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת וְלֹ֥א עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם יִהְיֶ֥ה הַגָּֽשֶׁם׃
Translated: Any of the earth’s communities that does not make the pilgrimage to Jerusalem to bow low to the Supreme G<small>OD</small> of Hosts shall receive no rain.
Transliteration: vehayah asher lo-yaaleh meet mishefechvot haarets el-yerushala͏im lehishetachavot lemelekhe yehovah tsevavot velo aleyhem yiheyeh hagashem

Hebrew: וְאִם־מִשְׁפַּ֨חַת מִצְרַ֧יִם לֹֽא־תַעֲלֶ֛ה וְלֹ֥א בָאָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה הַמַּגֵּפָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִגֹּ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יַעֲל֔וּ לָחֹ֖ג אֶת־חַ֥ג הַסֻּכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: However, if the community of Egypt does not make this pilgrimage, it shall not be visited by the same affliction with which G<small>OD</small> will strike the other nations that do not come up to observe the Feast of Booths.
Transliteration: veim-mishefachat mitserayiim lo-taaleh velo vaah velo aleyhem tiheyeh hamagefah asher yigof yehovah et-hagvoyim asher lo yaalu lachog et-chag hasukhvot

Hebrew: זֹ֥את תִּהְיֶ֖ה חַטַּ֣את מִצְרָ֑יִם וְחַטַּאת֙ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יַעֲל֔וּ לָחֹ֖ג אֶת־חַ֥ג הַסֻּכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: Such shall be the punishment of Egypt and of all other nations that do not come up to observe the Feast of Booths.
Transliteration: zot tiheyeh chatat mitserayiim vechatat khׇl-hagvoyim asher lo yaalu lachog et-chag hasukhvot

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא יִֽהְיֶה֙ עַל־מְצִלּ֣וֹת הַסּ֔וּס קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֤ה הַסִּירוֹת֙ בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּמִּזְרָקִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: In that day, even the bells on the horses shall be inscribed “Holy to G<small>OD</small>.” The metal pots in the House of G<small>OD</small> shall be like the basins before the altar;
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu yiheyeh al-metsilvot hasus kodesh layhovah vehayah hasiyrvot veveyt yehovah khamizerakiym lifeney hamizevecha

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיָ֠ה כׇּל־סִ֨יר בִּירוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם וּבִיהוּדָ֗ה קֹ֚דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת וּבָ֙אוּ֙ כׇּל־הַזֹּ֣בְחִ֔ים וְלָקְח֥וּ מֵהֶ֖ם וּבִשְּׁל֣וּ בָהֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֨ה כְנַעֲנִ֥י ע֛וֹד בְּבֵית־יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: indeed, every metal pot in Jerusalem and in Judah shall be holy to G<small>OD</small> of Hosts. And all those who sacrifice shall come and take of these to boil [their sacrificial meat] in; in that day there shall be no more traders in the House of G<small>OD</small> of Hosts.
Transliteration: vehayah khׇl-siyr viyrushala͏im uviyhudah kodesh layhovah tsevavot uvau khׇl-hazovechiym velakechu mehem uvishelu vahem velo-yiheyeh khenaaniy vod veveyt-yehovah tsevavot vayyvom hahu
